The table has border specified but if table spawns more than 1 page (that is
automatic page breaking is occured) then top/bottom border is missed.

creator: iistomin@ciklum.net
text:
Created attachment 18516
The input XSL-FO file producing the described output

The input file has no indentation because it is generated by another program.

Igor, the behaviour is correct. When you specify a border like you did it 
encompasses the whole element and is not repeated when the element is broken 
across pages. To force the border to be repeated you have to set the 
conditionality to retain for each border. Instead of 
    <fo:table ... border-before-width="1.0pt" ...>
you need to specify
   <fo:table ... border-before-width.length="1.0pt" 
                 border-before-width.conditionality="retain" ...>
and the same for the border-after-width.

See also the definition of the corresponding properties in section 7.9 of the 
XSL-FO 1.0 specification and section "4.3 – Spaces and Conditionality".
